div.l: Or make it rome / wᵗith speche as ys your͗e gise
Now Symond seid this Iohn by seint Cutberd
Ay is þᵘou mery / and that is faire answerd
I haue herd say / men sall ta of twa thynges
Slyke as he fyndes or ta slyke as he brynges
But specially I pray the hoost Dere
Gar vs haue mete and drynk and make vs chere
And we sall paye truely at the full
Wᵗith empty handes men may no haukes tull
Lo here our sylver redy for to spend
This Miller to the toun̄ his doughter send
For brede and ale / and rosted hem a goos
And bonde her hors it shold no more go loos
And in his owen̄ chambre hem made a bed
Wᵗith shetes and wᵗith chalons feir͗e yspred
Nat from̄ his owen̄ bedde ·x· fote or ·xij·
His doughter hade a bed all by hir selve
Right in the same chambre by and by
It myghte be no bette and cause why
There was no rommer herber in the place
They soupen / and they speke of solace
And drynken eủere stronge ale at þe best
About mydnyght þey went to rest
¶ Wele hath this Myller v̉ernysshed his hede
Full pale he was for drunk and nat rede
He yesketh and he speketh þurgh þe nose
As he were on̄ the quakke or on̄ the pose
To bedde he goth and wᵗith hym goth his wyf
As ony Iaye / he light was and iolyf
So was her ioly whistles well ywette
The cradle at her beddes fete is sette
To rokke and yeve the child souke
And whan þat drunken̄ all was in the crouke
To bed went the doghter right anoon̄
To bed goth Aleyn̄ and also Iohn
Ther nas no more / hem nedeth no dwale
This Miller hath so wisely bybed ale
That as an hors he snorteth in his slepe
Ne of his tail behynd he toke no kepe
His wyf bare hym a burdon̄ full strong
Men myght her rowtyng here a furlong
